Class DrawPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • DrawPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DrawPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This Class handles the creation and drawing of all the shapes. It extends JPanel. It is managed by the DrawFrame Class, such that every change that the user makes regarding the shapes that should be drawn will be updated in this class.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawPanel

        public DrawPanel(int maxShapeNum,
                 DrawFrame parentWindow,
                 javax.swing.JLabel statusLabel)
        constructor, sets the background color to be white. Then it initializes the 'shapes' array with the maximum capacity which was given to it. afterwards the constructor initializes the parentWindow reference. then it initilizes the the statusLable. Important to say that the first intialization is happening by the default of JVM. It will also create a new MouseHandler DrawPanel.MouseHandler which will handle the drawing on the panel and the statusLabel update and add it to the this panel.
        Parameters:
        maxShapeNum - the maximum capacity of shapes which could be drawn.
        parentWindow - the parents window so that we can send messages using JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(java.awt.Component, java.lang.Object) in DrawPanel.MouseHandler.mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent).
        statusLabel - the DrawFrame status label that will be updated in DrawPanel.MouseHandler.mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent)

    • Method Detail

      • setDrawingColor

        public void setDrawingColor(java.awt.Color currentColor)
        Parameters:
        currentColor - the color that will be drawn

      • setFilledShape

        public void setFilledShape(boolean filledShape)
        Parameters:
        filledShape - whether the shape will be filled or not

      • setShapeType

        public void setShapeType(int shapeType)
        Parameters:
        shapeType - the shape type that will be drawn

      • clearLastShape

        public void clearLastShape()
        Public method to keep track of the shape count after pressing the 'Undo' button. It will also use the JComponent.repaint(long, int, int, int, int) method that calls the paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics) method to redraw the panel without the last shape drawn.

      • clearDrawing

        public void clearDrawing()
        public method to keep track over the Clear button pressing It will also repaint the panel via JComponent.repaint(long, int, int, int, int) method that invokes paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics) method without the shapes that was drawn. It sets the shapeCount to be 0, so that when it will repaint it will repaint the shapes in shapes[] array up to index smaller than 0 (shapeCount), therefore will not draw anything.

      • createShape

        private MyShape createShape(int... coordinates)
        This private method handles the creation of shapes which was given by the DrawPanel.MouseHandler.mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent). it gets all the coordinates needed to create a shape than creates it, using the fileds that we have for current shape drawing(currentColor, filledShape, shapeType).
        Parameters:
        coordinates - the coordinates that needs to be drawn.
        Returns:
        returns a new shape acording to the current parameters and the coordinates which was given to it by the DrawPanel.MouseHandler.mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent) method in the handler, if an error occured it returns null.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        for each shape in the array, draw the individual shapes. if a shape is being drawn it will update the shape according to the users mouse movements (which is handled by DrawPanel.MouseHandler )
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
